meanings.definition: Protect or limit oneself against loss or harm with a hedge.
meanings.sent1: She hedged her investment to avoid losing money.
meanings.sent2: He always hedges his bets to minimize risk.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel hedged its nuts to keep them safe from other animals.
meanings.sent4: The knight hedged himself with armor before the battle.
meanings.sent5: The farmer hedged his crops to shield them from strong winds.

meanings.definition: Avoid making a direct statement or commitment.
meanings.sent1: Tom hedged when asked about his whereabouts last night.
meanings.sent2: Politicians often hedge their answers to avoid controversy.
meanings.sent3: The student hedged when questioned about completing the homework.
meanings.sent4: She hedged her response to keep her opinion private.
meanings.sent5: The child hedged when asked if they ate the last cookie.

meanings.definition: Surround or bound with a hedge.
meanings.sent1: The garden was hedged with beautiful flowers.
meanings.sent2: They hedged the property to create a natural barrier.
meanings.sent3: The park was hedged with bushes to define its borders.
meanings.sent4: The house was hedged with a fence for privacy.
meanings.sent5: The farm was hedged with shrubs to keep animals out.
